abstract: If you read the Food and Drink issue, you already know what rattlesnake tastes like: ''sinewy, half-starved tilapia,'' according to Maud Newton.
snippet: If you read the Food and Drink issue, you already know what rattlesnake tastes like: ''sinewy, half-starved tilapia,'' according to Maud Newton.
lead_paragraph: If you read Sunday's Food and Drink issue, you already know what rattlesnake tastes like: ''sinewy, half-starved tilapia,'' according to Maud Newton. Check out Maud's follow-up post on her blog to find out what raw rattlesnake looks like (''a garden hose made of filleted haddock'') and what might be needed to cut it safely (''hedge clippers''), among other details.
